words.example: I was not aware of the ringing phone.

words.definition: in a severe or harmful way
words.example: He hurt his arm badly playing with friends.
The blue suit belongs to Paul.
She stood under her umbrella as the rain continued to fall.

words.definition: something you do wrong; a mistake
words.example: I made an error on my report, so my boss was angry.

words.definition: something you have seen or done
words.example: Rock climbing was a fun experience.
The field of flowers looked so pretty.
She hurt her leg falling down the stairs.

words.definition: the ability to form opinions or decisions
words.example: It's good judgment to recycle your aluminum cans.
I will likely stay at home and watch TV tonight.
It is normal for me to bathe every night.
It is rare for him to miss his flight.
The frog relaxed in the warm sun.
The little girl requested a special gift from Santa Claus.
My brother and his family reside in a lovely house on the beach.

words.definition: something that happens because of something else
words.example: As a result of all the rain, the man had to climb on the roof.

words.definition: to move by turning over and over
words.example: You must roll the ball into the pins when you bowl.

words.definition: from a past time until now
words.example: Since 1992, he has been driving that car.
The moon and stars were visible in the night sky.
You should be careful around a fox, because it is a wild animal.
